channel.title: Dropped item right click option [Delta] [317] [Help]
channel.description: Why does it have ".." as a option. I noticed most customs about 7000+ id has this problem. It bugs me because when there is a drop party, players are going to have to right click for the good stuff. [img]http://img843.imageshack.us/img843/6889/5whv.png[/img]

item.title: Dropped item right click option [Delta] [317] [Help]
item.dc:creator: @Vodzila Vodzila
item.description:
@Vodzila wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:19, topic:525943”]Try adding something like this:
class8.aStringArray168 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray168[2] = “Take”;[/quote]
MOTHER OF GOD I FIXED IT! There was another random selection above the “Take” in client.java (Client Side)

Read full topic

item.title: Dropped item right click option [Delta] [317] [Help]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Vodzila, post:14, topic:525943”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=644687.msg4337734#msg4337734 date=1374647807]
You don’t have any ground actions added to the ints.
these ones are for a renamed client but you need something like this:
itemDef.groundActions = new String[5];
itemDef.groundActions[2] = “Take”;
That sets the ground actions.
[/quote]
Bro this is 317… It’s class8 not itemdef[/quote]
You really didn’t read…
those ints are for a 317 renamed client…
I said you need something like that. I’m sure there’s an array for ground actions in your class8.java

Read full topic

item.title: Dropped item right click option [Delta] [317] [Help]
item.dc:creator: @Vodzila Vodzila
item.description:
@Vodzila wrote:

[quote=“4x4Chevrolet, post:10, topic:525943”]Well hm. That’s not it then,

post the code cammy was talking about.[/quote]
if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerRights >= 2)) {
String[] args = command.split(" ");
if(args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if (newItemID <= 16000 && newItemID >= 0) {
addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
sM(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
sM(“Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100”);
}
}
}

Read full topic
